8B2572575421453F8ED61C41446B4C44.description: Demonstrates knowledge and use of job-specific tools and technologies.

53CFFDB447A741038510A9D5FCB7E0BB.description: Demonstrate continuous learning and adaptability skills to changing job requirements.

79BC3ACC272244DCA34A1C5088F88254.description: Demonstrate career and life management skills and goal-making.

CAB4443346B94EF482ADB11198098BDB.description: Proficient professionals know the academic subject matter, including positive work practices and interpersonal skills. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in any program of study.

F1B86BB7D8084DEBB4A1F146477CE2A0.description: Demonstrate critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

CB89175A89C64FA1B2324CA15B091040.description: Proficient professionals know the academic subject matter, including positive work practices and interpersonal skills. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in any program of study.

CEA4C3AF374B42C295C9E1D6CEB897EA.description: Describe possible threats to a laptop, tablet, computer, and/or network and methods of avoiding attacks.

4662A4137B914F2384E1285109C63ECA.description: Describe ethical and legal practices of safeguarding the confidentiality of business- related information.

7CA6A3A0A8CC4430A2B6F7D50D935B80.description: Analyze accessibility laws and their impact on the end-user.

3D71A9317F654F8BB11B5EDC232A140E.description: Define the impact of the Americans with Disabilities Act and other civil rights legislation on a business/organization, its employees, and its customers.

8991E8634453412D8506C8F89C9995D1.description: Define differences between classroom and professional practices in regard to copyrights.

3D5C0B19D8F74C08A6A58A81FC34C718.description: Discuss legal issues and the terms of use (e.g., plagiarism) related to copyright laws, fair use laws, and ethics pertaining to downloading of images, photographs, documents, video, sounds, music, trademarks, and other elements for personal use.

CAACA0D2603240D78848D7CF7CF63DE1.description: Explain the consequences of social, illegal, and unethical uses of technology (e.g., piracy; cyberbullying; illegal downloading; licensing infringement; inappropriate uses of software, hardware, and mobile devices in the work environment).

5A36674AF37D46FD9B704DAF1599E963.description: Identify potential abuse and unethical uses of laptops, tablets, computers, and/or networks.

2336547222634FEFB0ECDD9C0A853372.description: Identify proper netiquette when using e-mail, social media, and other technologies for communication purposes.

A5FA0EB783A64EE1867600C42D7E6810.description: Demonstrate proficiency and skills associated with the use of technologies that are common to a specific occupation.

498E8CA1C6614A20AFF8503CC56B6E5B.description: Proficient professionals know the academic subject matter, including the ethical use of technology. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

754F5DDFB3E1438D9AF85673381842D6.description: Explain how participation in CTSOs can promote lifelong benefits in other professional and civic organizations.

64D64CF8C4C844CE9F3E26B9A92CB65B.description: List leadership opportunities that are available to students through participation in CTSO conferences, competitions, community service, philanthropy, and other activities.

448A836F30CF48EF9D5778A254B0AF67.description: Explain the benefits and responsibilities of being a member of a CTSO.

CBAAB2A2BAB942CA9FA6344693C36D2B.description: Explain how CTSOs are integral parts of specific clusters, majors, and/or courses.

AF968F562C9546FFA5C5B191749B4C52.description: Identify the purpose and goals of a Career and Technology Student Organization (CTSO).

CF6D0616EB5B44ED8223DD13CA836E32.description: Proficient professionals know the academic subject matter, including professional development required for proficiency within their area. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in any program of study.

5CFB7034060142E5976FF460722C79C6.description: Identify contact information for classroom emergencies.

70D9A6562B44425DB37CBBBB6D91DD45.description: Proficient professionals know the academic subject matter, including safety as required for proficiency within their area. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in any program of study.

10E1685A8AB64FF5ACA4A918777FA3CC.description: Evaluate the user interface and enhance the user experience through web design best practices.

998AE3160028482D957934733C0E384C.description: Proficient professionals demonstrate appropriate animation skills. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

BF65EF2E61914A1E8C26645BAAB3A158.description: Provide and receive constructive feedback on photographs by participating in critiques.

61641C0D145D4012B5D4ADBA3A8F2343.description: Demonstrate post-processing skills by utilizing more advanced editing software for photo enhancement.

64D94FE9720745E186578614A30C8E12.description: Demonstrate and identify the application of visual storytelling through photography.

EE23EE114931411FB5C9421B0C09B3D9.description: Demonstrate basic editing by performing basic cropping, rotation, and exposure adjustments using simple editing tools.

9F2C1A0BDD08462EB6890E27A1DF5D46.description: Demonstrate advanced use of composition elements and techniques by composing simple and balanced shots using the rule of thirds, framing, leading lines, and perspective.

26732F6272724889AAAB18DB3906DEAC.description: Demonstrate the use of a camera and flash modifiers such as umbrellas, reflectors, or gels to alter the light and shadow created by the flash unit.

F494288CE4564AC48B3205290EC3D4CA.description: Demonstrate the use and operation of studio flash units to create and control artificial light sources.

38AF8719A94D4A5A9FE57F876375680E.description: Demonstrate the application of focus, aperture, shutter, and ISO to achieve a properly exposed image, and to achieve the desired effect.

1CF881EE06524FFFB7A534BEA76EC984.description: Capture digital images using a scanner and other digital devices.

905BAC1F8EC14170A7DE98A5E5F69284.description: Digital artists demonstrate appropriate photography skills. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

508FFBE9248145C6AACA9A5E9CFBDB44.description: Render and export their compositions for publication to the desired output format.

9A9877828DCC4028A13B0B49EF7F98DA.description: Demonstrate the application of text animators, text presets, shape tools, and shape modifiers to create dynamic typography and graphics.

5C1FCE6C02D648C697AC6991E3CB883F.description: Create, edit, and animate text and shape layers.

0E21508B68764C2F8E9EF8AF100C70C2.description: Demonstrate the application of effects and presets to enhance the appearance and functionality of layers.

A31CC6501D4E484D9996B1A060FEFC96.description: Use keyframes, expressions, and graphs to animate the properties and attributes of layers

F60114A3B19749C6ACC017DBB25847A1.description: Use blending modes, track mattes, masks, and alpha channels to control the visibility and transparency of layers

02AE3354F77048C59A0AED05BB1FD0E8.description: Use precomps (precomposing), nesting, and proxies to optimize and simplify their workflow.

EAEA58A86F4C4C3EBCFE1244E3EF3A2A.description: Create, modify, and arrange compositions and layers.

E4E301C137CC41F5B1A2DCF8FACB549A.description: Use folders and labels to organize and document their project.

22CDF685172742108F256C310640AB2C.description: Create, import, and organize assets in a project.

11D633217B654CCC9C0D8C1C492703A2.description: Digital artists demonstrate appropriate animation and motion graphics skills using Adobe After Effects or equivalent software. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

116BB6AC84C947F58A617B7F75A41B79.description: MOTION GRAPHICS: (modeled after ADOBE AFTER EFFECTS)

A37CDB7E2C5B4EAA8727CF0E11F4F3CA.description: Demonstrate the use of Redshift renderer to create advanced lighting and material designs.

7600C21572734391A2AFC9E6672ECEF9.description: Demonstrate how to prepare a design for export into another application.

BAB035BFF1CE4DB092EA972CEED0871E.description: Demonstrate effective typographical design and animation.

D2C5F3381C9342D487EBB9F1F41695D9.description: Demonstrate effective use of cameras, lighting, and rendering tools to create a desired effect.

2B2AE2F9F99443188CB5F1B39DDD1103.description: Apply the elements and principles of design to compose effective 3D designs.

A358C26A30AA47ACA6763CE8D45411E0.description: Demonstrate the use of fields to control elements.

633F7B53DB3B4B8FB87788863ACA13D8.description: Demonstrate the use of MoGraph to create dynamic animations.

05B92113DBFE46309CD5447750F7B82B.description: Create and edit 3D models, animations, and simulations using Cinema 4D.

DF485E199BAC4172805294FCB3F28A74.description: Professionals demonstrate appropriate animation and motion graphics skills using Cinema 4D. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

5CC43DB980F542E28F3E334C4AF6CF56.description: Experiment with lighting in the scene.

35205599CE7849BAA87E31C26ED675CC.description: Demonstrate the use of polypainting to develop a model (e.g., nanomesh, fibermesh).

69382F87DE07486DA5437E93220BAC61.description: Utilize Zspheres to block out a design.

9C7C9DAA81904260ABFB1407FDDBDE9E.description: Demonstrate how to properly prepare a model for compositing in Photoshop or other appropriate application.

09BC5BA45D8C41368D466487FCAF4B1A.description: Demonstrate the use of various types of brushes and tools. (e.g., brushes, symmetry, smoothing).

E389EE198C4E4A828EA1C752C8019BE1.description: Use primitives and DynaMesh basics to work efficiently (e.g., sculpting, combining, imperfections).

40F62F92CAA34D57B59D6691F66777FF.description: Demonstrate efficient navigation of the Zbrush interface (e.g., gizmo, camera).

AD21011AC03442C5B2CF2B7F4FCCD887.description: Professionals demonstrate appropriate character and concept development skills. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

FFE00F3BB7A1430593DF22B49F7C9716.description: Use appropriate technical, software, or hardware tools to create an original digital artwork which integrates an identified emerging technology (e.g., virtual reality, augmented reality, or 3D printing).

7A22B0834ECE4A38AD9D18C67805D46A.description: Identify and describe an emerging technology, whether technical, software, or hardware- based and its application in the digital art world.

5A365A43719848CABAE027C98F71D597.description: Digital artists explore emerging technologies to enhance and improve their existing skills. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

D587E9C23A964EEE9C00BC3C86502060.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Product Visualization Designer – Uses renderings, images, and artwork to visually communicate products to customers.

FD2BC5506BBE43A4BC67C23B5DE4CD06.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Character Designer – Create and draw the visual elements which describe the characters, environments, and props associated with characters in game design and other media.

6E7F482A95DD45FC8528E27E31720C03.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a 3D Rendering Specialist –A 3D rendering specialist utilizes drawings and technical information to construct 3D models representative of the client’s desired goals.

CF3544B7AC764F689247F52ACE805D6C.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Concept Artist – Concept artists develop the initial visual concepts (characters, props, vehicles, environments) from a script or creative brief.

457D453DD95E4E16B333C730643083B8.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Colorist – A colorist in the film industry creates a visual story for a production, through adjusting the hues in the corrected film through color grading techniques.

88FEB9D99E1F4CCD9B02AA56785AF137.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Motion Graphic Designer – Create artwork for the web, television, or film. They use visual effects, animation and other cinematic techniques to bring life to their creations.

848A12EE819A4A5588EC008E68E7D4B6.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a User Experience (UX Designer) – UX designers make products, services and websites enjoyable and accessible for users. They consider the intended end-use of the product and how the product feels to the consumer to ensure it is a user-friendly product or service.

63457E17017D493E986745B93C4F4366.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a User Interface (UI) Designer – The UI designer is responsible for ensuring every webpage or operational step of the final product follows the user experience (UX) designer's intent.

8E74878DDC85455FA9F7AEAF0D4C2EE6.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of an Art Director – The art director is a high-level executive responsible for guiding the design team's vision, directing the theme concept and overseeing all design artwork. They can work in a variety of industries including fashion, print publications, advertising, television or consumer products.

ACD75CE969BC49F39D1624642AD5DB43.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Publication Designer – Publication designers develop the layout, visual appearance and graphics for a range of printed publications. Companies that create annual reports, research papers, books, catalogs and user manuals use internal or freelance publication designers to add images and graphics to the written information.

92CF678A75B1408EAFC7E5A83F2B82E1.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of an Advertising Designer – Advertising designers use graphic design, sketching and photography to create visually compelling marketing materials for a brand or company. They create billboards, magazine advertisements, website advertisements and any other requested promotional materials.

061AF49ACBF24FE5B0B86B46871D2028.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Multimedia Designer – Multimedia designers create complex animated images and videos using art and computerized animation programs. They plan out the animation by sketching, creating scale models and developing computerized graphics to build the story.

BB3958367F5F4D109AA51FEE7542F4DD.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Web Designer – Web designers assist in developing websites by creating individual web pages, designing page layouts and developing graphics for the website. They are also responsible for designing the navigation menus, drop-down options and the website's structure.

7DFAC914FE154FE290DACC116D513B40.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Packaging Designer – Packaging designers—or production designers—develop the box, container and labels on a product to protect the product during shipping and communicate important features to the customer.

46EC1572922941D58F40C792B9FC182C.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Logo Designer – Logo designers develop visually compelling graphics or symbols to represent a company, product, brand or service.

1DBEDE1EE61540DFB0930CBF95370FAB.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of an Apparel Designer – Apparel graphic designers create individual, original images for clothing. They develop a strong understanding of the brand's customers and ensure their graphics are cohesive and visually appealing to that audience. They design a variety of images and font-based graphics for screen printing on shirts, pocket-placed embroidery designs and any other special designs or prints the brand's design executives want to include on their clothing.

ED7D1193024543BCBBD341A26F3C9FC6.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the responsibilities of a Photo Editor – Photo editors work with real-life images to adjust, color-correct or combine images to create the desired final image. Image editing can be as simple as adjusting the lighting and color balance on a photograph or as drastic as changing garment colors or adding logo information or banners to the image.

B2A51721B3994C2C80DB2504D0C9D8B4.description: Digital artists have knowledge of the career pathways found in the Digital Art and Design industry. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

46C8BFF7F4BC4426BBC605F960BBCBF1.description: Maintain open and timely communication with the client regarding changes in scope or cost of the project.

E15A0F34268746E6A72614F9AFF7C262.description: Receive and respond to client feedback by iterating designs as required.

E3C3AFE8B3CB4CBA962C39C3804CD6BE.description: Present work to the client using appropriate media and format.

BE2B6DF0CE9048E48608214EACEDDA9F.description: Establish a regular communication schedule with the client.

2BBC650EB0334C0BB4E2B5EBA49FE9DB.description: Digital artists demonstrate appropriate designer/client relationships. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

7C7F1FCE0E4D44F7A79A31FDDAD129F4.description: Describe the differences between, and the advantages/disadvantages of: in-line; off-line; and, near-line finishing.

57B941A0F1AE40A3BFF6EB52416BE822.description: Explain how copyright laws apply to printing companies.

431C6A2A9F394C9BAA652C8947A4726B.description: Summarize the use and application of various industry standards and specifications.

6BC2637D5188489AB89BCB4F3020FFCF.description: Explain the basic fundamentals of a business, such as cost, estimates, and productivity.

20963FBF74884544A421823C21B296BA.description: Investigate methods for protecting/managing intellectual property rights (e.g., Creative Commons vs. professional trademark/patent/legal services).

A42EA86D2177472ABBA20363285C5998.description: Evaluate personal productivity over the course of a design project.

3D25E2B873FB433FAF6513E8C83DCED6.description: Summarize practices for planning and growing successful services.

9A55C32286CB4B41AE145D768632E233.description: Demonstrate strategies to promote digital design/art services.

81EA50A810754699B555AC41E54FACE9.description: Prepare a digital design/art services quote for prospective work.

B9BCA644494D407EBE9DA20BD21CB376.description: Digital artists demonstrate appropriate business skills and knowledge. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

422F1A4D1DEE4447AA23CFED58B288A9.description: Analyze, refine and iterate design based on client and/or peer feedback.

F90193C26B9C42C69D07E5CEC09BC710.description: Communicate with others (such as peers and clients) about design plans.

0CB10BB8BA1943189736A7A51A661620.description: Demonstrate knowledge of project management tasks and responsibilities.

0704A389478545B086B5E7F3936530CC.description: Identify the purpose, target market and audience market for the final product(s).

CD9F05326EC845F5B84B6D9465A07E79.description: Digital artists acquire appropriate certifications/credentials. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

F008CFD7ADB048709A82B12F05136669.description: Prepare and test for College and Career Ready certification(s).

609078919BA6471288F7345661B712A4.description: Digital artists acquire appropriate certifications/credentials. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

0400E83AD3784728A6517CDF2EE0B468.description: Investigate independent digital art and design opportunities.

BDCEEBEB7BBF45FB8CEB583DAF83D680.description: Explain the importance of obtaining media releases.

73ADAFC68E4F4007A6B87491AD047464.description: Demonstrate application of creative commons licenses and how they are used in the design industry.

F9B206A9153743088A38BF5CFE733FE9.description: Research different kinds of networking opportunities.

F4C4D6E66868420EB830A10592946DB7.description: Explain the advantages of different types of portfolios.

3C9C2303859B49E29153E4B9AFB6AA48.description: Digital artists demonstrate appropriate professional development skills and knowledge. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.

63E2471C72AC4EBEB8A41EA40624DC79.description: Exhibit evidence of proficiency among multiple portfolio pieces in the following practices.

57B8863F92DB417DB384B7770F895736.description: Digital artists present and maintain a portfolio of their work consistent with fundamental design practices. The following accountability criteria are considered essential for students in the Digital Art and Design program of study.
